result.title: Guide on addressing vulnerable groups and gender issues
result.description:
Third of a series of specific guidance on a number of horizontal issues, drawing on the experiences of the demonstration measures. These will look at three topics:
• The financing, procurement and contracting of SUMP measures • The inclusion of suburban districts in SUMPs • Addressing vulnerable groups and gender issues in SUMPs
The guidance will draw directly on the outcomes of the thematic webinars being held within WP9.

result.description: This Deliverable will be the final output of Task 3.3, which builds on the results reported in D3.3 and IR3.3. This final version of the IMOVE data translators and reference information model will take into account the results of the final tests at the Living Labs.

result.title: Live Case Studies
result.description: The development work implemented in the pilot cities Hamburg, Rome and London will be documented in three ‘Live Case Studies’, similar to Blogs. Starting with a first version in month 6, they will be further elaborated and updated every 3 months until they reach their final version at the end of the project. The Live Case Studies will be available through the project website, the final version will be published as pdf and printed versions.

result.title: Stakeholder Dialogue Events: 5 Events during period
result.description: Key stakeholder groups relevant for the replication of the smarticipate outcomes will be invited to a series of five one-day Dialogue Events, where they will receive first-hand information on the applications and processes developed in the pilot cities. They will take place during months 16-21.

result.title: Contextualisation, Dissemination, Replication Strategy
result.description: At the beginning of the project, a comprehensive strategy will be elaborated that links all contextualisation, dissemination and replication tasks and their related products. The strategy defines the phases and key contents of the project’s communication, the target groups addressed, the channels used and the roles each partner plays. It will be reviewed annually (months 15 and 27) and modified if needed.
